etymologies: Old English wice, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch week and German Woche, from a base probably meaning ‘sequence, series’

examples.text: he'd cut the grass a week ago

definitions: the period of seven days generally reckoned from and to midnight on Saturday night

examples.text: she has an art class twice a week

shortDefinitions: period of seven days generally reckoned from and to midnight on Saturday night

definitions: workdays as opposed to the weekend; the five days from Monday to Friday

examples.text: I work during the week, so I can only get to this shop on Saturdays

definitions: the time spent working in the workday period of five to seven days
a period of five or seven days devoted to a specified purpose or beginning on a specified day
shortDefinitions: period of five or seven days devoted to specified purpose

definitions: used after the name of a day to indicate that something will happen seven days after that day

examples.text: the program will be broadcast on Sunday week

shortDefinitions: used after name of day to indicate that something will happen seven days after that day
